boat.hyper_ol package

Submodules

boat.hyper_ol.cg module

class boat.hyper_ol.cg.CG(ll_objective: Callable, ul_objective: Callable, ll_model: Module, ul_model: Module, ll_var: List, ul_var: List, solver_config: Dict)[source]

Bases: HyperGradient

Calculation of the hyper gradient of the upper-level variables with Conjugate Gradient (CG)`[1]`.

:param : :type : param ll_objective: The lower-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_objective: callable :param : :type : param ul_objective: The upper-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_objective: callable :param : :type : param ll_model: The lower-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ul_model: The upper-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ll_var: List of variables optimized with the lower-level objective. :param : :type : type ll_var: List :param : :type : param ul_var: of variables optimized with the upper-level objective. :param : :type : type ul_var: List :param : :type : param solver_config: Dictionary containing solver configurations. :param : :type : type solver_config: dict

References

[1] A. Rajeswaran, C. Finn, S. M. Kakade, and S. Levine, “Meta-learning

with implicit gradients”, in NeurIPS, 2019.

compute_gradients(ll_feed_dict: Dict, ul_feed_dict: Dict, auxiliary_model: _MonkeyPatchBase, max_loss_iter: int = 0)[source]

Compute the hyper-gradients of the upper-level variables with the data from feed_dict and patched models.

Parameters:

  • ll_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the lower-level data used for optimization. It typically includes training data, targets, and other information required to compute the LL objective.

  • ul_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the upper-level data used for optimization. It typically includes validation data, targets, and other information required to compute the UL objective.

  • auxiliary_model (_MonkeyPatchBase) – A patched lower model wrapped by the higher library. It serves as the lower-level model for optimization.

  • max_loss_iter (int) – The number of iteration used for backpropagation.

Returns:

the current upper-level objective

boat.hyper_ol.cg_iad module

class boat.hyper_ol.cg_iad.CG_IAD(ll_objective: Callable, ul_objective: Callable, ll_model: Module, ul_model: Module, ll_var: List, ul_var: List, solver_config: Dict)[source]

Bases: HyperGradient

Calculation of the hyper gradient of the upper-level variables with Conjugate Gradient (CG) [1] and Initialization-based Auto Differentiation (IAD) [2].

:param : :type : param ll_objective: The lower-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_objective: callable :param : :type : param ul_objective: The upper-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_objective: callable :param : :type : param ll_model: The lower-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ul_model: The upper-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ll_var: List of variables optimized with the lower-level objective. :param : :type : type ll_var: List :param : :type : param ul_var: of variables optimized with the upper-level objective. :param : :type : type ul_var: List :param : :type : param solver_config: Dictionary containing solver configurations. :param : :type : type solver_config: dict

References

[1] A. Rajeswaran, C. Finn, S. M. Kakade, and S. Levine, “Meta-learning

with implicit gradients”, in NeurIPS, 2019.

[2] Finn C, Abbeel P, Levine S. Model-agnostic meta-learning for fast adaptation of deep networks[C]. in ICML, 2017.

compute_gradients(ll_feed_dict: Dict, ul_feed_dict: Dict, auxiliary_model: _MonkeyPatchBase, max_loss_iter: int = 0)[source]

Compute the hyper-gradients of the upper-level variables with the data from feed_dict and patched models.

Parameters:

  • ll_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the lower-level data used for optimization. It typically includes training data, targets, and other information required to compute the LL objective.

  • ul_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the upper-level data used for optimization. It typically includes validation data, targets, and other information required to compute the UL objective.

  • auxiliary_model (_MonkeyPatchBase) – A patched lower model wrapped by the higher library. It serves as the lower-level model for optimization.

  • max_loss_iter (int) – The number of iteration used for backpropagation.

Returns:

the current upper-level objective

boat.hyper_ol.cg_iad_ptt module

class boat.hyper_ol.cg_iad_ptt.CG_IAD_PTT(ll_objective: Callable, ul_objective: Callable, ll_model: Module, ul_model: Module, ll_var: List, ul_var: List, solver_config: Dict)[source]

Bases: HyperGradient

Calculation of the hyper gradient of the upper-level variables with Conjugate Gradient (CG) [1], Initialization-based Auto Differentiation (IAD) [2] and Pessimistic Trajectory Truncation (PTT) [3].

:param : :type : param ll_objective: The lower-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_objective: callable :param : :type : param ul_objective: The upper-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_objective: callable :param : :type : param ll_model: The lower-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ul_model: The upper-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ll_var: List of variables optimized with the lower-level objective. :param : :type : type ll_var: List :param : :type : param ul_var: of variables optimized with the upper-level objective. :param : :type : type ul_var: List :param : :type : param solver_config: Dictionary containing solver configurations. :param : :type : type solver_config: dict

References

[1] A. Rajeswaran, C. Finn, S. M. Kakade, and S. Levine, Meta-learning

with implicit gradients[C]. in NeurIPS, 2019.

[2] Finn C, Abbeel P, Levine S. Model-agnostic meta-learning for fast adaptation of deep networks[C]. in ICML, 2017. [3] Liu R, Liu Y, Zeng S, et al. Towards gradient-based bilevel optimization

with non-convex followers and beyond[C]. In NeurIPS, 2021.

compute_gradients(ll_feed_dict: Dict, ul_feed_dict: Dict, auxiliary_model: _MonkeyPatchBase, max_loss_iter: int = 0)[source]

Compute the hyper-gradients of the upper-level variables with the data from feed_dict and patched models.

Parameters:

  • ll_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the lower-level data used for optimization. It typically includes training data, targets, and other information required to compute the LL objective.

  • ul_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the upper-level data used for optimization. It typically includes validation data, targets, and other information required to compute the UL objective.

  • auxiliary_model (_MonkeyPatchBase) – A patched lower model wrapped by the higher library. It serves as the lower-level model for optimization.

  • max_loss_iter (int) – The number of iteration used for backpropagation.

Returns:

the current upper-level objective

boat.hyper_ol.iad_ptt module

class boat.hyper_ol.iad_ptt.IAD_PTT(ll_objective: Callable, ul_objective: Callable, ll_model: Module, ul_model: Module, ll_var: List, ul_var: List, solver_config: Dict)[source]

Bases: HyperGradient

Calculation of the hyper gradient of the upper-level variables with Initialization-based Auto Differentiation (IAD) [2] and Pessimistic Trajectory Truncation (PTT) [3].

:param : :type : param ll_objective: The lower-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_objective: callable :param : :type : param ul_objective: The upper-level objective of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_objective: callable :param : :type : param ll_model: The lower-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ll_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ul_model: The upper-level model of the BLO problem. :param : :type : type ul_model: torch.nn.Module :param : :type : param ll_var: List of variables optimized with the lower-level objective. :param : :type : type ll_var: List :param : :type : param ul_var: of variables optimized with the upper-level objective. :param : :type : type ul_var: List :param : :type : param solver_config: Dictionary containing solver configurations. :param : :type : type solver_config: dict

References

[1] Finn C, Abbeel P, Levine S. Model-agnostic meta-learning for fast adaptation of deep networks[C]. in ICML, 2017. [2] Liu R, Liu Y, Zeng S, et al. Towards gradient-based bilevel optimization

with non-convex followers and beyond[C]. In NeurIPS, 2021.

compute_gradients(ll_feed_dict: Dict, ul_feed_dict: Dict, auxiliary_model: _MonkeyPatchBase, max_loss_iter: int = 0)[source]

Compute the hyper-gradients of the upper-level variables with the data from feed_dict and patched models.

Parameters:

  • ll_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the lower-level data used for optimization. It typically includes training data, targets, and other information required to compute the LL objective.

  • ul_feed_dict (Dict) – Dictionary containing the upper-level data used for optimization. It typically includes validation data, targets, and other information required to compute the UL objective.

  • auxiliary_model (_MonkeyPatchBase) – A patched lower model wrapped by the higher library. It serves as the lower-level model for optimization.

  • max_loss_iter (int) – The number of iteration used for backpropagation.

Returns:

the current upper-level objective

Calculation of the hyper gradient of the upper-level variables with Reverse Auto Differentiation (RAD) [1], Pessimistic Trajectory Truncation (PTT) [2] and Reverse Gradient Truncation (RGT) [2].
